name: Walk to Fanueil Hall: 4 Bed / 2.5 Bath plus Patio!
summary: Amid the flickering glow of historic gas lamps on one of Charlestown’s most desirable streets rests this beautifully restored 3 story, 4 bedroom, 2.5 bathroom, 2,300 square foot historic 1855 home with relaxing outdoor space.  This home retains its historic charm, but has been recently renovated with all new HVAC and plumbing. The home was re-wired with new electric and well-placed light and smoke detectors to code. Walk to downtown Boston & Fanueil Hall from this safe and quiet spot!
space: This FAMILY-FRIENDLY home is located on Monument Avenue, the avenue that is capped by the Bunker Hill Monument and Freedom trail. With a Walk Score of 92 you are just steps to restaurants, Whole Foods, 92 or 93 bus 10 minutes to downtown, the Orange “T” line, and every convenience you are looking for in picture-perfect, historic Charlestown: Boston’s oldest neighborhood. This spacious and energy efficient home has new central AC and forced hot air. The first floor opens to a marble entry that leads to freshly refinished hardwood floors in an open concept 30’ x 15’ living and dining room. The dining room seats 6 and with a leaf in the table - 8. There is a TV located in this room and you have access to basic cable, HBO & Showtime, Netflix and Chromecast.  The Kitchen has custom cabinets, black granite countertops, stainless steel sink and stainless steel appliances including dishwasher, refrigerator, and gas range with microwave hood. A powder bath is adjacent to the kitchen and expansi

neighborhood_overview: Charlestown is Boston's oldest neighborhood that has recently been "rediscovered" by families and millennials alike. We love the quiet, neighborly feel of the area that is removed just enough from the hustle of downtown... yet it's just a stones throw away and easily accessible by foot.  Check out (Website hidden by Airbnb) to explore the history of the area.
notes: NA
transit: Most people on the street do not own a car, we walk everywhere, grab a blue bike rental or Uber. There is also the 92 or 93 bust that is a quick ride through downtown and ending at Downtown Crossing and Boston Common. The Orange Line's Community College "T"-station is a 7 minute walk.
access: Full access available to deck off of kitchen. Below the deck is a shared space.
interaction: I am available by text anytime - feel free to ask questions about the house, the neighborhood or even things to do in Boston! I can meet you at the house at check-in, or simply gain access with a personalized key code that works only during your stay.
house_rules: - Patio accessible between 10AM -10PM

name: Historic Getaway in Charlestown
summary: This is a huge apartment! I do not need all the space, so I have turned the bottom into a fully dedicated Airbnb. While it is technically a shared apartment, this space is entirely separate and dedicated solely to my Airbnb guests. My suite provides the perfect space for a solo or family getaway. Located in the heart of Boston, you can enjoy the convenience of walking to so many different must see attractions.  This space has been professionally decorated! Book my place for a stress free trip!
space: This unique space is exceptionally homie feeling ... and comfortable. There is a common area, an excellent bedroom with a Queen Bed, and a second bedroom with 2 single beds.

house_rules: - Quiet hours are from 10:30pm to 7am
host_about:
I moved to Victoria via Calgary and Prince Edward Island.  I guess being Island  born (Prince Edward Island) explains why I am so drawn to the ocean..... and this ocean doesn't freeze!   My family moved to Calgary for the  booming economy in 2003. Once I finished high school, I moved to Victoria because I love kiteboarding and spent quite a bit of time in Victoria riding my bike for training camps with my team. There are many great cycling routes and paths to explore.  Whether it be the dense forest, vast ocean, rugged mountains, or vibrant city, Victoria offers everything I admire in a place to call my home. I look forward to sharing my knowledge of the city, whether you are returning to Victoria for business or vacation, or coming for the first time.

I also run a Airbnb in Golden, BC! 
My family bought a "cabin" here in 2007, we have enjoyed years of use at this cabin. Now that our family is getting older, we dont use the cabin as much anymore, but we love sharing it with others! It is located 8km south of Golden, in an ideal location for Mountain Biking, XC skiing, Snowmobiling, Para-Gliding and so many other awesome outdoor activities!

host_about:
Hello there!

We are a Husband & Wife duo living in historic Boston, Massachusetts! After spending a couple of uninspiring years in America's private sector, we reached the mutual conclusion that we had to focus on what we love most - Planet Earth and traveling to see all of its beauty! And that's pretty much where and how Sleepy Panda began! Together, we design and renovate unique eco-vegan homes that inspire eco-consciousness while promoting sustainable living. Our eco-vegan homes revolve around a central ethos of love for planet and respect for all sentient beings on Earth!

We can't wait to meet you!

name: Spacious room at the Bunker Hill Monument
summary: Our apartment is basic but welcoming. Situated a short walk from the Bunker Hill Monument at the end of Boston’s historic freedom trail, guests can be in downtown Boston or Cambridge with just a short walk or ride on the T.  The apartment is spacious with a living room, kitchen/dining room and bathroom. Perfect for those on vacation or traveling for work.
space: NA
description: Our apartment is basic but welcoming. Situated a short walk from the Bunker Hill Monument at the end of Boston’s historic freedom trail, guests can be in downtown Boston or Cambridge with just a short walk or ride on the T.  The apartment is spacious with a living room, kitchen/dining room and bathroom. Perfect for those on vacation or traveling for work. In addition to their bedroom, guests will have access to the kitchen, living room and bathroom. We’re comfortable socialising with guests or giving them space, depending on their preference.  We are both young working professionals so tend to be up and out early during the week, so the apartment would be mostly vacant during those times. Charlestown is a friendly, beautiful neighbourhood with plenty of local amenities. We are situated right between the two main streets, providing easy access to a variety of great options for eating and drinking, tourist favorites and boutique stores. The bus stop is less than a minute walk from our fr
neighborhood_overview: Charlestown is a friendly, beautiful neighbourhood with plenty of local amenities. We are situated right between the two main streets, providing easy access to a variety of great options for eating and drinking, tourist favorites and boutique stores.
notes: We don’t have parking at the building but there is a school parking lot less that 200 yard away which is free to use on weekends, however you cannot use during the week. Charlestown is home to many great bars and restaurants, which are within walking distance.
transit: The bus stop is less than a minute walk from our front door and the MBTA station is less than 10 minutes walk away. Either transport option would get you to the heart of Boston within 10 minutes of boarding or, you could enjoy a short walk into downtown Boston in around 20 minutes. If you're going further afield, you can be on any of the main highways within around 5 minute drive and Ride-sharing options (Uber/Lyft) are always available.

host_about:
Hello there!

We are a Husband & Wife duo living in historic Boston, Massachusetts! After spending a couple of uninspiring years in America's private sector, we reached the mutual conclusion that we had to focus on what we love most - Planet Earth and traveling to see all of its beauty! And that's pretty much where and how Sleepy Panda began! Together, we design and renovate unique eco-vegan homes that inspire eco-consciousness while promoting sustainable living. Our eco-vegan homes revolve around a central ethos of love for planet and respect for all sentient beings on Earth!

We can't wait to meet you!

space: Beautiful, recently constructed single family 3 bedroom home with hard- and landscaped patio in one of the most desirable neighborhoods in Boston. Very friendly, low-profile cats do co-habit, though not in guest bedrooms.  :)

neighborhood_overview: Historic, significantly gentrified, quiet.  A highly desirable neighborhood on the fringe of Boston's downtown.
notes: Street parking with resident sticker only is what's mostly available.  There is, however, a pay-lot located by about a 3-5 minute walk.
transit: The bus that drops and picks you up stops at the end of my street, and the Orange line is a 3-5 minute walk.  A cab or an Uber can get you to the North End or downtown (approx. 1.5 mi. away) within minutes.
access: Enjoy a fully furnished bedroom, ample closet space, your own bathroom shared only with at most one other if another guest is also staying.  Light use of kitchen and common areas, including a beautiful, extra bright & spacious finished basement are also available to you.
interaction: Professional owner who enjoys conversation and sharing tips for getting around and exploring is also happy to hear about your experiences, adventures and finds.  Those who've stayed before have enjoyed the comforts of a home and proximity to all of Boston made easy by a full range of convenient transportation options.
house_rules: - Quiet but sociable host who looks for the same in individual guests.  No guests of guests please. - Request that shoes not be worn in the house to protect the hardwood floors.  Recommend slippers/socks with rubber bottoms/treads. - Not provided: hairdryer, shampoo, conditioner, or other personal amenities.

name: Charming, bright, walk anywhere in historic Boston
summary: Welcome to our home! There's lots of natural light during the day, beautiful views at sunset, and plenty to explore in the city that's just a few minutes walk away. My partner and I enjoyed living here for almost 2 years while I worked in the Navy Yard. The Freedom Trail and Bunker Hill Monument are outside the windows, and the Constitution is docked a mile away. Send me a message if you want to know more!
space: When you walk in, this small apartment feels very spacious thanks to the high ceilings and large windows. The bedroom and bathroom are to the left, and the kitchen and living area are ahead through the hall. There is a lot of natural light and warmth during the day from the big windows - it's lovely to sunbathe in the mornings! Temperature is controlled by a thermostat in the winter (set to 50 when no one's home, change it when you arrive). During warmer weather, the windows provide a delightful sea breeze, and there is window air conditioning for the very hot days. However, as this is an old building, the temperature indoors may not be ideal on very hot or very cold days.  The TV with a (Hidden by Airbnb) chromecast (Queasy Beancast) is available for your enjoyment. The kitchen is fully equipped, help yourself to any food that's in the cabinets or fridge. There is a Nespresso machine, French press coffee maker, toaster, and microwave. The closet, beside tables, and dresser are availab
description: Welcome to our home! There's lots of natural light during the day, beautiful views at sunset, and plenty to explore in the city that's just a few minutes walk away. My partner and I enjoyed living here for almost 2 years while I worked in the Navy Yard. The Freedom Trail and Bunker Hill Monument are outside the windows, and the Constitution is docked a mile away. Send me a message if you want to know more! When you walk in, this small apartment feels very spacious thanks to the high ceilings and large windows. The bedroom and bathroom are to the left, and the kitchen and living area are ahead through the hall. There is a lot of natural light and warmth during the day from the big windows - it's lovely to sunbathe in the mornings! Temperature is controlled by a thermostat in the winter (set to 50 when no one's home, change it when you arrive). During warmer weather, the windows provide a delightful sea breeze, and there is window air conditioning for the very hot days. However, as this
neighborhood_overview: Charlestown resembles a small European city with cobbled streets, lots of green space, and many families taking strolls throughout the day. Our proximity to the waterfront provides a gentle sea breeze - it keeps dank city smells at bay.  Whole Foods, CVS, post office, bank, and liquor store are a 5 min walk from the apartment. Along the streets are small shops and restaurants. I recommend Charlestown Tea & Treats (across the street from apt) for breakfast and their home made ice cream! While walking around, you can try to locate the potato monument the park :)
notes: A thermostat in the hall controls the heating for the whole apartment. It is set to 50F while no one is living there, but you may change it. Please set it back to 50F when you check out. Text me if you need instructions on using the thermostat and I'll be happy to explain. In the summer, window air conditioners keep the apartment nice and cool.
transit: Access these destinations within 20 minutes: The Garden at North Station (Celtics & Bruins games!), North End, Freedom Trail, Constitution museum, Science museum, Bunker Hill Monument, Aquarium, Seaport, Quincy Market, Harvard Square, Massachusetts General Hospital, Navy Yard, downtown crossing shops, and many more. There is a bus stop right outside the apartment for the 93 & 92 lines, which bring you downtown in 5 to 15 minutes. In the other direction, you'll go towards Somerville's main bus station from where you can reach anywhere the MBTA goes. The orange line is a 10min walk to Bunker Hill Community College (take a right ot the door). The green line & commuter rail is a 15min walk to North Station (take a left out the door). Biking is likely the fastest way to get around Boston. There are bike rentals available all around the city during most of the year. Walking is a great option, too, most destinations are within a 3-mile radius of the apartment. Uber or Lyft are very common and
access: You are welcome to use the entire apartment except the locked part of the closet. Contact me about longer rentals, and we can discuss access to the washer/dryer. Please be mindful of the neighbors and common spaces (doors, stairs, & halls). Check-in is preferred between 9am and 7pm, but can be at almost any time as long as guests give me a reasonable window. Check-out is at 5pm, please let me know if you will be leaving earlier or need to stay later.
interaction: I'm easily reached by text through the AirBnB app or my cell phone. If you want to talk on the phone, let me know and we'll set up a convenient time for both of us. I try to accommodate my guest's needs, so please don't hesitate to make requests.
house_rules: There is street and garage parking available nearby. Please wash your dishes, you may use the dishwasher (pods are under the kitchen sink). No cigarettes or cigars in the house. There is a smoking lounge in the bar downstairs. Children and pets are not advised in this listing because the apartment is small. Please message me with questions. No parties, the apartment is too small for more than 4 adults.
host_about:
I'm a scientist working near Boston and living in the suburbs with my partner. We are often drawn to secluded, naturally beautiful areas, but are also happy to hang out with laid back people. Our favorite vacation activities are hiking, foraging, and exploring the history of the place we're visiting.
Our old Boston apartment is listed for rent on AirBnB - we haven't had the heart to sell it now that we've moved to the 'burbs. It's a great city location in a beautiful area of Charlestown near the ocean. I prefer being a hands-off host because of the distance, but am eager to provide everything my guests need prior to their arrival.

summary: The most spectacular penthouse triplex with first class finishes in this beautiful 1 bedroom 1 loft  designer decorated home in the beautiful Navy Yard in Charlestown. Hello!

Thanks for checking out my properties!  

My name is Dawn and I have been living in beautiful historical Charlestown for the last 16 years. My property is near and dear to my heart as this was my grandparents home that I pretty much grew up in and that I bought after they passed away. You will enjoy staying here and all this city has to offer_ I will make sure of it!  :) 
 
Thank you and I look forward to meeting you!  

Dawn

There are Blue Bikes bicycle rentals at the bottom of the hill, and you can easily walk downtown in half an hour. Parking is free on the weekends. If you want to park your car, we're a 5-10 minute walk from the Nautica Parking Garage down by the waterfront, or there's an MBTA commuter parking garage ($5/day if you park on the top floors) attached to the Wellington MBTA station (Orange Line, two stops North)

neighborhood_overview: The North End, Boston’s Little Italy, is a maze of narrow streets with some of the city’s oldest buildings. On the self-guided Freedom Trail, tourists pass historic sites like the 1680 Paul Revere House and the Old North Church, which played a key role at the beginning of the Revolutionary War. Italian restaurants, coffeehouses, pastry shops and old-school delis pack the area, especially on lively Hanover Street. Cambridge is a city in Massachusetts, across the Charles River from Boston. It’s home to Harvard University. At the heart of campus, grassy Harvard Yard is anchored by the neoclassical Widener Library. Harvard Square has cafes, bars and bookstores. The Harvard Art Museums comprise the Fogg, Busch-Reisinger and Arthur M. Sackler collections. Southeast is the prestigious Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT). The Financial District is downtown’s business nerve center, crowded with stately banks, high-rise offices and sleek condos. Post Office Square, home to Norman B. Leve

name: Neighborhood Feel, Walk to DT Boston!
summary: Welcome to our home! During your stay in the oldest neighborhood of Boston, you'll enjoy the quiet, safe streets at night and the short walk to downtown Boston during the day. There's plenty to explore in Charlestown including the Freedom Trail and Bunker Hill Monument. Our 1 BR apartment offers a queen bed and pull-out sofa in the common area. While this may not be a luxury apartment, the convenient location, cleanliness, and cozy space is all you need for your stay Boston! Have a great visit.
space: Our sunny, homey first floor apartment is great for couples or small groups visiting Boston. It is ideally suited for 2 guests, but can accommodated up to 4. Walkable to the North End/TD Garden, but far enough way from the hustle and bustle of downtown to feel at home in the quiet, historic neighborhood of Charlestown. Our apartment is perfect for a site seeing weekend or trip to Boston for a game/concert at TD Garden. For history buffs, we recommend starting the Freedom Trail at Bunker Hill Monument, just minutes away on foot, and working your way backwards into downtown Boston. Not up for walking? Save money on Ubers and walk 7 minutes to the orange line Community College "T" train stop, 2 stops from down town Boston.  One bedroom provides queen bed and a pull-out sofa couch is available in the living room. Please let us know if you plan to use the sofa couch, as we will have linens available only upon request. Located close to: Freedom Trail, USS Constitution, Paul Revere's house, O

Our apartment is perfect for a site seeing weekend or trip to Boston for a game/concert at TD Garden. For history buffs, we recommend starting the Freedom Trail at Bunker Hill Mon
neighborhood_overview: WHAT TO EXPECT A small-town sensibility within the city’s limits. THE LIFESTYLE Tranquil living with Boston’s culture and industry at your fingertips. WHAT NOT TO EXPECT Rowdy nightlife or upscale shopping. Luxury apartment.  THE MARKET Boston’s oldest neighborhood boasts historic homes with period detail and Navy Yard luxury condominium living. YOU'LL FALL IN LOVE WITH Picnics on Breed’s Hill and chowder at the local tavern.
notes: No wheelchair access. Please be aware Boston is an old city and most homes were built in the 1800's. Walls can be thin and you may hear upstairs neighbors and people coming in and out of the building.  Besides weekday mornings, we find our building to be extremely quiet. Ear plugs will be accessible for your convenience! We ask that you respect our neighbors as well by keeping music at a moderate level. This is an original apt in a older Charlestown building- they don't make them like this anymore. You'll have real beautiful hardwood floors and high ceilings with original details and solid walls with lots of light and space. However, these kinds of places can and do come with some light wear and tear of course but that's what gives it its charm, so if you're looking for a cookie cutter brand spanking new squeaky clean condo like space this is not the place for you :)
transit: Walk to down town Boston, rent a Blue Bike bike share, or take the orange line train in from Community College T stop.  If you have a car, metered parking is available on Main St. Non-resident parking is available on-street on weeknight evenings and weeknights but is extremely limited. The nearest parking garage is Nautica garage at 88 Constitution Road, Charlestown.
access: NA
interaction: We prefer to hand the keys off in person and will be available via Airbnb messenger and phone for the duration of your stay!
house_rules: - Please respect our neighbors by not playing loud music.

neighborhood_overview: The Charlestown neighborhood in Boston is the perfect place for a couple or family looking for a safe, beautiful, historic and centrally located place to stay. We are steps away from many parks, including the Bunker Hill Monument. Take a walk down to the North End, downtown or enjoy great restaurants and coffee shops right in Charlestown.
notes: NA
transit: This apartment is right next to 93 bus stop, a short walk from 92 bus and the Orange Line, all of which will quickly bring you downtown. Charlestown is known for being extremely walkable through beautiful cobblestone streets and historic brownstone houses. Plenty of free parking on weekends (not available weekdays 8am-8pm) and right off of highway 93 for easy access and no hassle of having to drive through the city.  10 minute walk to Bunker Hill Monument 10 minute walk to downtown Charlestown (Wholefoods, CVS, Coffee Shops, Restaurants) 15 minute bus into the downtown (Haymarket) 15 minute walk to the T (metro train) - Orange Line (Community College) 15 minute walk to Charlestown’s Historic Navy Yard 30 minute walk to the North End (Boston’s historic little Italy) 10-20 minute drive to Boston Logan International Airport 30 minute walk to TD garden (or 15 min bus ride)

summary: 2 Bedroom, Guest Suite apartment on Breeds Hill, less than a block from the historic Bunker Hill Monument! This fully-furnished, ground level unit (no stairs) has easy access to all major highways into and out of the city. About a mile walk to TD Garden, this space is perfect for visits to the city for events or extended weekends. neighborhood_overview: Almost as old as Boston itself, Charlestown and the immediate area is host to most of the USA's founding history including US Navy Flagship USS Constitution and Bunker Hill Monument, both connected with the Freedom Trail honoring "The Midnight Ride". Dine in some of the country's best Italian restaurants in the nearby North End for a romantic night out or experience Boston's lively night life in the West End, and much more all within walking distance! The property was once owned by the family of WWII soldier James M Connolly,  who joined the Army with his longtime childhood friend William J Ryan who lived across the street. Both men received multiple honors including the Purple Heart after being killed in service before the end of their first enlisted year.
notes: I provide starter supplies, that includes TP in bathroom,  paper towels, an xtra garbage bag, dish detergent, a dishwasher pod, soap and shampoo, coffee, tea and some snacks. Beyond the starter supplies is up to YOU - there's a store down the street.
transit: The Nautica Parking Garage is recommended. It's about a 5minute walk. Parking is available on the street over weekends starting at 8pm Friday and ends 8am Monday. Two-hour visitor parking available at both ends of street. A bus runs at the end of the street, and goes into downtown Boston Haymarket Stop (about 1 mile away). The Community College stop is about a ten minute walk from the house.
access: Guests can access entire apartment and outside patio. The grill is available, and after using please clean it.
interaction: Unless other arrangements are made, we will meet you to give you keys and give an overview for your stay. This is a completely separate legal apartment in townhouse accessed via a side alley & private courtyard.
house_rules: Let me be clear, the pricing of this rental agreement is based on the number of guests staying. If other guests are staying with you, that needs to be shown in the guest count. In most instances I do not charge for children, but I need to know who is staying here. It's a violation of house rules to give an incorrect guest count.  If we determine that other people are staying with you overnight you will be charged for those guests.  Most guests are super considerate and fun. Together we, the AirBnB community, keep things in good condition for the next traveler. I only want guests who truly appreciate this service. Think of this stay as being in your friend's apartment while they are away. While I am compensated, it's a great deal while here for business or for families traveling together.  You will have access to the entire apartment, but do not disturb any bedrooms you are not staying in. If made beds are messed up beyond your booking request, you will be charged $50. If the guest coun
host_about: Thanks for taking a look at the extended stay rental at ecoNewBedford. I am the owner/developer of this smart growth mixed-use project in New Bedford's South End beach village. With a team of associates, we are working to enhance the quality of life of this almost secret place. I like all of the fun people who have found us; they are an interesting group.

house_rules: Dear guest please follow the house rules, it is important for us to keep our house clean and comfortable for every one. 1- no shoes at home ( feel free to bring ur own sleeper)  2- no smoking at home or at the garden  3- no extra electric Heaters or other things inside the room with out host permission. 4- please give us call one hour before reaching to our place, call or message both is fine. name: 2Bed / 2Bath Private Outdoor Space and Central A/C
summary: Entire townhouse is yours! Fully furnished with central A/C and private outdoor space with firepit and charcoal grill.  Located near Encore, TD Garden, Assembly Row and the North End you're also walking distance to Charlestown landmarks and bars. First floor has bedroom with queen bed and full bath. Second floor hosts kitchen with stainless steel appliances and living room with Netflix/Sling. Third floor has master bedroom with queen bed, full with jacuzzi bath and in unit laundry.
space: The townhouse includes bed/bath linens and kitchen and bath essentials. The two bedrooms have their own full bathrooms and are located on the first and third floors allowing space and privacy for guests. On site laundry is located on third floor off the master bedroom and includes laundry detergent. Surrounded by string lights, the charming private outdoor area includes dining table for 6, grill and a firepit and lounge chairs for guests to enjoy warm summer nights.

neighborhood_overview: Across the street you'll find a walking path bringing you to a boardwalk with picnic tables and docks. Next to the house you'll find a public park with playground. You are also walking distance to historic Charlestown landmarks such as the USS Constitution in the Navy Yard and Bunker Hill Monument, and a few minutes drive to Encore Casino, TD Garden, the North End aka 'little Italy' of Boston and all other major Boston attractions.
notes: NA
transit: Free weekend parking! Located near the Orange Line on the MBTA, Sullivan Sq and Community College are nearby stops. Citi bike rentals are available on Main Street and Medford Street as well. Water Taxis run from the Navy Yard and are operated through Boston Harbor Cruise. Weekday Parking info -  Street is resident parking from 8am-8pm Monday-Friday and 2 hour parking 8am-6pm Monday-Friday on adjacent street.  Detailed map can be provided.

name: Great Bedroom with in suite bathroom
summary: Very nice master bedroom with in suite bathroom. The apartment has two bedroom and one of them is already on Airbnb, so I've decided to add the other bedroom as a new experience. The walk in closet is reserved for some personal stuff, but the room has enough storage for you. The bedroom can be locked and the guest will have a proper key.
space: The apartment is very nice and it is located in a great location. you will have your keys and will be available to get in and out any time, independent of other guest.

name: Charming Studio minutes to downtown Boston
summary: Hello! I live in a studio apartment in Charlestown, a charming neighborhood in Boston, very convenient to downtown and super close to the new casino, Encore, that just opened. It's a 3 min walk to the Sullivan Square T stop on the orange line, and just a few stops to downtown and connecting T lines (the T is the subway).  My apartment is small but pleasant, with good light, a washer and dryer, and stainless steel appliances. I can clear up some space in the walk-in closet for guests' luggage.
space: My building complex is called Mezzo Apartments and has a small gym and a nice outdoor courtyard with sitting areas and grills. I can also provide a parking spot in the garage. I have 2 cats and a dog so anyone with allergies might not want to stay here--although I keep the apt clean, dog and cat hair is tough to get rid of completely! There is a double bed, and the couch is a loveseat (comfy but only good for sleeping for someone small). My apt is on the first floor overlooking the courtyard and is very safe--a fob is used to get into the building, and a key to the apt itself.

neighborhood_overview: Charlestown is charming and historical, and I live near the Bunker Hill monument and narrow cobblestone streets lined with brownstones, great for exploring. I am within walking distance of Assembly Row (area with shopping and restaurants) Encore Casino and cafes, bars and every practical amenity you can think of--grocery stores, banks, etc.
notes: NA
transit: I am on the border of Charlestown and East Somerville: a 2 min walk to the T (public transportation), a quick taxi ride to downtown Boston, and my building has a parking garage you can use with a guest pass I will provide.
access: NA
interaction: I will most likely be at my boyfriend's in Plymouth--about an hour away. But I will be accessible via phone for any questions/concerns--texting is best.

name: Charlestown houseboat, walk to Boston attractions
summary: Skip the hotel and do something really unique and fun! Experience Boston from the perspective of your own floating home! Nestled in a protected marina in Boston Harbor, our houseboat is fully equipped with all the comforts and amenities of home! The boat is fully air conditioned in the summer and heated during the winter. The covered front deck has outdoor seating.  Sip your cocktail and watch the harbor traffic . Free Wi-Fi is included in your rental.   Parking is $25 per day
space: Perfect for 2  it can also be an economical choice for 4 with the sleep sofa in the living room. We are located in the Charlestown Marina. Accessible via water taxi, car, or taxi. Walk to the USS Constitution, Bunker Hill , TD Garden and the North End. MBTA water shuttle is a short walk. UBER readily available. Parking is available at $25 per day and will be billed separately. Located in a very secure and gated marina, our houseboat is just minutes away from downtown Bostons' most popular attractions; Fanueil Hall/Quincy Market, the North End, the New England Aquarium, the Children's Museum and the Boston Convention Center. Our convenient location makes it easy for you reach points of interest. We just acquired this houseboat but have owned other boats for several years

name: 3+ Month Boston Rental with Private Parking Spot
summary: Greetings, I'm James and looking to rent my second bedroom in 2 Bed / 2 Bathroom apartment in charming brick townhouse located in historic Charlestown neighborhood of Boston MA.  Minimum 3 months stay. Off street personal parking spot is a rare perk. Also included is a walk-in closet, in unit new washer-dryer, dish washer, gas fire place, kitchen balcony and roof deck. Beautiful sweeping views of downtown skyline view are a must see. Look forward to speaking with you.
space: Fully furnished.  Just need your personal belongings. Utilities included: TV/Wi-Fi, Central AC, heat etc. The apartment is located by the Tobin Bridge so you will hear some highway traffic.  It doesn't bother me, its the city after all but just FYI.

name: Charlestown Navy Yard 2Bed/2 Bath & FREE parking
summary: Available starting SEPTEMBER 2019!!  Welcome to Boston!! If you're looking for a clean, safe, and convenient place to rest your head with a reliable host, then look no further. This location is perfect for anyone visiting Boston, going to Encore Casino (2 miles away),  attending meetings at MGH Institute, or visiting a  loved one at  Spaulding Rehabilitation Hospital. Please feel free  to message me with any questions!
space: Welcome to the Basilica Condominiums. This is a historic building in the Navy Yard with 92 units. We  have owned our unit  (apartment unit #122) for 3 years but we do not live there, we live in Arlington (15 minutes outside of Boston). We had tenants the past 2 years, but decided this year we are going to do Airbnb again.  We are registered and  approved by the City of Boston to be a Airbnb host.   If you are looking for a SAFE, CLEAN place with "minimalist" decor then this is the place for you.  We had great success when we did Airbnb in Summer 2017 with this minimalistic approach. We believe you don't come to Boston to hang out in your  hotel or apartment, you are out and about exploring the beautiful city and just need a clean, safe, quiet place to lay your head at night after a busy day.  THE SPACE: There is a queen bed in the  master bedroom,  and 2 twin beds in the second  bedroom (so 3 beds in total: 1 queen &  2 twin beds).  We WILL provide: Toilet paper, napkins, paper towels,

neighborhood_overview: Charlestown Navy Yard is beautiful !  Everyone is out and about exploring the sights!  As you can see from the pics, our building is right by the water. Additionally,  the Boston Police station is 2 minutes away and MGH  &  Spaulding Hospital each have their own police cruisers that drive around monitoring the area. Between the police station, security details for MGH and Spaulding,  you should feel very safe!!   Within short walking distances there is a Bank of America ATM, Dunkin's, and a  7- Eleven  on 1st ave that has a wide selection of food/snacks/beer/wine/ & basic necessities. Our condo is about a 7 minute Uber ride to Encore Casino. There is a Whole Foods (5 minute car ride away from apartment). FOOD:   There are  tons of trendy restaurants in Charlestown (The Warren Tavern, Figs by Todd English,  Tangierino Restaurant and Lounge, Legal Oysteria, Monument Restaurant & Tavern, Brewer's Fork.  Specifically in the Navy Yard there is:  Pier 6, Style Cafe, Navy Yard Bistro, DECCA,
notes: - Overall there are 4 SIMPLE  but MAJOR rules  to remember (which I already stated above) 1) Don't park in wrong parking spot.  2) Don't lose garage door opener.  3) Don't try to access our unit through the front lobby of the building.  As stated above, the entrance to our unit is on 1st ave (you'll see the lock box on our front door) 4) No smoking in the unit OR around the building premise. -No wi-fi or cable at this time !!! (Dunkins & Style Cafe have free Wi-Fi) -Sorry, no pets!!
transit: - PARKING your car: The apartment comes with 1 spot in the attached garage. It is parking spot #37. There is $100 fee if you park in the WRONG spot in addition your car WILL BE TOWED  at guests expense if you are not parked in the correct spot. So PLEASE make sure you park in the clearly labeled spot ( parking spot #37). I can't stress this enough!!!  - Take the Charlestown Ferry from the Navy Yard (Located at Pier 4)  to Boston Long-Wharf (Where the  New England Aquarium is located). This ferry runs year round and tickets are $3.70 one way trip . It's about a 10 minute ride,  (up to two kids under 11 ride free when accompanied by a paying adult).  Ferry runs daily every 15-30 minutes. If you plan to use this, I can send you the daily schedule.  - Public transportation available in the Navy Yard includes: MGH Shuttle Bus - Shuttles run from MGH building in the Navy Yard on 13th Street (right in front  of our building) to North Station, Red Line (Charles/MGH) and MGH Hospital. - MBTA -
